articles.content: Displace first tried its hand at reimagining the TV in 2023, with a wireless screen that suctions onto walls and features built-in rechargeable batteries. articles.title: Google’s Gemini app can check videos to see if they were made with Google AI
articles.description: Google expanded Gemini's AI verification feature to videos made or edited with the company's own AI models. Users can now ask Gemini to determine if an uploaded video is AI-generated by asking, "Was this generated using Google AI?" Gemini will scan the video's visuals and audio for Google's propriet
articles.content: Google expanded Gemini's AI verification feature to videos made or edited with the company's own AI models. Users can now ask Gemini to determine if an uploaded video is AI-generated by asking, "Was this generated using Google AI?" Gemini will scan the video's visuals and audio for Google's proprietary watermark called SynthID . The response will be more than a yes or no, Google says. Gemini will point out specific times when the watermark appears in the video or audio. The company rolled out th
articles.author: Elissa Welle

The company plans on littering search results with advertisements beginning next year . Currently, the App Store only has one ad spot. That's at the very top of searc
articles.content: Apple just announced it will be integrating more ads into the App Store because our poor eyeballs must be assaulted at all times. The company plans on littering search results with advertisements beginning next year . Currently, the App Store only has one ad spot. That's at the very top of search results. If you search for something like Instagram it's likely that top spot will be filled with an ad for a rival social media platform. The new ads will appear further down the actual search

Bloomberg reported on Wednesday that the automaker will suspend production in Japan on January 5 and 6. (Honda didn't specify the affected factories.) In addition, all three of the automaker's G
articles.content: The ripples of the auto industry's chip shortage are still being felt, as evidenced by Honda. Bloomberg reported on Wednesday that the automaker will suspend production in Japan on January 5 and 6. (Honda didn't specify the affected factories.) In addition, all three of the automaker's Guangqi Honda Automobile plants in China will shut down from December 29 to January 2. The halt is an outgrowth of a chip shortage stemming from a recent geopolitical proxy war in the Netherlands, of a

articles.description: Build Voice AI Applications with No-Code: Retell AI Guide to Success TL;DR Most no-code voice AI projects fail because they treat speech-to-text and text-to-speech as black boxes‚Äîmissing latency, barge-in handling, and session state. Retell AI abstracts these away, but you still need to architect fu
articles.content: Build Voice AI Applications with No-Code: Retell AI Guide to Success TL;DR Most no-code voice AI projects fail because they treat speech-to-text and text-to-speech as black boxes‚Äîmissing latency, barge-in handling, and session state. Retell AI abstracts these away, but you still need to architect function calling, webhook validation, and fallback logic. This guide shows how to build production voice interfaces without touching audio pipelines, using Retell's conversational AI platform to handle

articles.content: Between all the new phones, smartwatches, and laptops we see throughout the year, it often feels like we're constantly being nudged toward shinier, more expensive gadgets. I use the Leatherman Free T4 every day , while Donkey Kong Bananza has provided me (and other Verge staffers ) with hours of entertain

For clean to mid-gain tones alone, I already have more terrific options than I need, including NeuralDSP‚Äôs Tone King and Cory Wong and Mateus Asato , PolychromeDSP‚Äôs Lumos , and Universal Audio‚Äôs new Parad

articles.title: Does swearing make you stronger? Science says yes.
articles.description: "A calorie-neutral, drug-free, low-cost, readily available tool for when we need a boost in performance.‚Äù
articles.content: If you‚Äôre human, you‚Äôve probably hollered a curse word or two (or three) when barking your shin on a table edge or hitting your thumb with a hammer. Perhaps you‚Äôve noticed that this seems to lessen your pain. There‚Äôs a growing body of scientific evidence that this is indeed the case. The technical term is the ‚Äú hypoalgesic effect of swearing. ‚Äù Cursing can also improve physical strength and endurance, according to a new paper published in the journal American Psychologist. articles.content: LG says it will let users delete the Microsoft Copilot shortcut it installed on newer TVs after several reports highlighted the unremovable icon. In a statement to The Verge , LG spokesperson Chris De Maria says the company "respects consumer choice and will take steps to allow users to delete the shortcut icon if they wish." articles.content: When the Perseverance rover arrived on Mars nearly five years ago, NASA officials thought the next American lander to take aim on the red planet would be taking shape by now. At the time, the leaders of the space agency expected this next lander could be ready for launch as soon as 2026‚Äîor more likely in 2028. Its mission would have been to retrieve Martian rock specimens collected by the Perseverance rover, then billed as the first leg of a multilaunch, multibillion-dollar Mars Sample Return ca
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: The 8 worst technology flops of 2025
articles.description: Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. This year, politics was a recurring theme. Donald Trump swept back into office and used his executive pen to reshape the fortunes of entire sectors, from renewables to cryptocurrency. The wrecking
articles.content: Welcome to our annual list of the worst, least successful, and simply dumbest technologies of the year. This year, politics was a recurring theme. Donald Trump swept back into office and used his executive pen to reshape the fortunes of entire sectors, from renewables to cryptocurrency. The wrecking-ball act began even before his inauguration, when the president-elect marketed his own memecoin, $TRUMP, in a shameless act of merchandising that, of course, we honor on this year‚Äôs worst tech list.
articles.author: Antonio Regalado
